00015 // Generally useful function used for RANSAC.
00016 // Randomly chooses n distinct indices into the set
00017 void bundler_utils_get_distinct_indices(
00018     int n, int *idxs, int number_entries)
00019 {
00020     for (int i = 0; i < n; ++i) {
00021         bool found;
00022         int idx;
00023 
00024         do {
00025             found = true;
00026             idx = vcl_rand() % number_entries;
00027 
00028             for (int j = 0; j < i; ++j) {
00029                 if (idxs[j] == idx) {
00030                     found = false;
00031                     break;
00032                 }
00033             }
00034         } while (!found);
00035 
00036         idxs[i] = idx;
00037     }
00038 }

00041 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00042 // A wrapper for vpgl_triangulate_points
00043 double bundler_utils_triangulate_points(
00044     const bundler_inters_track_sptr &track)
00045 {
00046     vcl_vector<vpgl_perspective_camera<double> > persp_cameras;
00047     vcl_vector<vgl_point_2d<double> > vgl_points;
00048 
00049     for (unsigned int i = 0; i < track->points.size(); ++i) {
00050         if (track->contributing_points[i]){
00051             vgl_points.push_back(track->points[i]->point);
00052             persp_cameras.push_back(track->points[i]->image->camera);
00053         }
00054     }
00055 
00056     assert(persp_cameras.size() == vgl_points.size());
00057     assert(persp_cameras.size() >= 2);
00058 
00059     // Actually do the triangulation.
00060     return
00061         vpgl_triangulate_points::triangulate(
00062             vgl_points, persp_cameras, track->world_point);
00063 }

00066 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00067 // Estimates a homography and returns the percentage of inliers
00068 double bundler_utils_get_homography_inlier_percentage(
00069     const bundler_inters_match_set &match,
00070     double threshold_squared, int num_rounds)
00071 {
00072     int inlier_count = 0;
00073 
00074     // RANSAC!
00075     for (int round = 0; round < num_rounds; ++round) {
00076         int match_idxs[4];
00077         bundler_utils_get_distinct_indices(
00078             4, match_idxs, match.num_features());
00079 
00080         // Fill these vectors with the points stored at the indices
00081         vcl_vector<vgl_homg_point_2d<double> > rhs;
00082         vcl_vector<vgl_homg_point_2d<double> > lhs;
00083 
00084         for (int i = 0; i < 4; ++i) {
00085             lhs.push_back(
00086                 vgl_homg_point_2d<double>(
00087                     match.matches[match_idxs[i]].first->point));
00088 
00089             rhs.push_back(
00090                 vgl_homg_point_2d<double>(
00091                     match.matches[match_idxs[i]].second->point));
00092         }
00093 
00094         // Get the homography for the points
00095         vgl_h_matrix_2d<double> homography(rhs, lhs);
00096 
00097         // Count the number of inliers
00098         vgl_homg_point_2d<double> lhs_pt, rhs_pt;
00099 
00100         int current_num_inliers = 0;
00101 
00102         vcl_vector<bundler_inters_feature_pair>::const_iterator m;
00103         for (m = match.matches.begin(); m != match.matches.end(); ++m)
00104         {
00105             lhs_pt.set(m->first->point.x(), m->first->point.y());
00106 
00107             rhs_pt = homography(lhs_pt);
00108 
00109             double dx = (rhs_pt.x() / rhs_pt.w()) - m->second->point.x();
00110             double dy = (rhs_pt.y() / rhs_pt.w()) - m->second->point.y();
00111 
00112             if (dx*dx + dy*dy <= threshold_squared) {
00113                 ++current_num_inliers;
00114             }
00115         }
00116 
00117         if (inlier_count < current_num_inliers) {
00118             inlier_count = current_num_inliers;
00119         }
00120     }
00121 
00122     return ((double) inlier_count) / match.matches.size();
00123 }

00126 //----------------------------------------------------------------------
00127 void bundler_utils_fill_persp_camera_ransac(
00128     const bundler_inters_image_sptr &image,
00129     int ransac_rounds,
00130     double inlier_threshold)
00131 {
00132     const double thresh_sq = inlier_threshold * inlier_threshold;
00133 
00134     // Get a list of all corresponding 3d points
00135     vcl_vector< vgl_point_2d<double> > image_pts;
00136     vcl_vector< vgl_point_3d<double> > world_pts;
00137 
00138     // Look at every feature in the set
00139     vcl_vector<bundler_inters_feature_sptr>::const_iterator f;
00140     for (f = image->features.begin(); f != image->features.end(); ++f) {
00141         if ((*f)->track && (*f)->track->observed){
00142             //This is the image point.
00143             image_pts.push_back((*f)->point);
00144 
00145             //Now get the world point
00146             world_pts.push_back((*f)->track->world_point);
00147         }
00148     }
00149 
00150     assert(world_pts.size() == image_pts.size());
00151     assert(world_pts.size() >= 6);
00152 
00153     int best_inliers = 0;
00154     vpgl_perspective_camera<double> camera_estimate;
00155 
00156     for (int rnd = 0; rnd < ransac_rounds; ++rnd) {
00157         vcl_vector< vgl_point_2d<double> > curr_image_pts(6);
00158         vcl_vector< vgl_point_3d<double> > curr_world_pts(6);
00159 
00160         // Get the points to use in this RANSAC round
00161         int match_idxs[6] = {0};
00162         bundler_utils_get_distinct_indices(
00163             6, match_idxs, image_pts.size());
00164 
00165         for (int idx = 0; idx < 6; idx++) {
00166             curr_image_pts[idx] = image_pts[match_idxs[idx]];
00167             curr_world_pts[idx] = world_pts[match_idxs[idx]];
00168         }
00169 
00170 
00171         //Construct the camera from these correspondences.
00172         double err = 0;
00173         vpgl_perspective_camera<double> camera;
00174 
00175         assert(
00176             vpgl_perspective_camera_compute::compute_dlt(
00177                 curr_image_pts, curr_world_pts, camera, err) );
00178 
00179         // Find the inlier percentage to evaulate how good this camera
00180         // is.
00181         int inlier_count = 0;
00182         for (unsigned int pt_ind = 0; pt_ind < image_pts.size(); ++pt_ind) {
00183 
00184             if (camera.is_behind_camera(vgl_homg_point_3d<double>(world_pts[pt_ind])))
00185                 continue; // cheirality violation
00186 
00187             double u, v;
00188             camera.project(
00189                 world_pts[pt_ind].x(),
00190                 world_pts[pt_ind].y(),
00191                 world_pts[pt_ind].z(),
00192                 u, v);
00193 
00194             const double dx = u - image_pts[pt_ind].x();
00195             const double dy = v - image_pts[pt_ind].y();
00196 
00197             if (dx*dx + dy*dy <= thresh_sq) {
00198                 ++inlier_count;
00199             }
00200         }
00201 
00202         // Now see if this is the best camera so far.
00203         if (inlier_count >= best_inliers) {
00204             camera_estimate = camera;
00205             best_inliers = inlier_count;
00206         }
00207     }
00208 
00209     vcl_cout << "add_image: best_inliers: " << best_inliers << " / " << image_pts.size() << '\n';
00210 
00211     //------------------------------------------------------------------
00212     // Now that we have an estimate for the camera, re-do it into a more
00213     // expected form.
00214     vgl_point_2d<double> principal_point;
00215     principal_point.x() = image->source->ni() / 2.0;
00216     principal_point.y() = image->source->nj() / 2.0;
00217 
00218 #if 0 // unused...
00219     const vpgl_calibration_matrix<double> &k =
00220         camera_estimate.get_calibration();
00221     const double observed_focal_length = .5 *
00222         (k.get_matrix()(0, 0) +
00223          k.get_matrix()(1, 1));
00224 #endif
00225     vpgl_calibration_matrix<double> calibration_mat(
00226         image->focal_length, principal_point);
00227 
00228     vpgl_perspective_camera<double> actual_camera(
00229         calibration_mat,
00230         camera_estimate.get_rotation(),
00231         camera_estimate.get_translation());
00232 
00233     image->camera = actual_camera;
00234 }
